page.title: 06The Post Office
page.content: Rolleston is a sub-post office.It has a Postmaster and Postmistress three postwomen and one relief worker.The mail comes in at half past five in the morning and is sorted.At six o'clock the postwomen go out and they cover twelve hundred houses up to Dovecliff Road,Rolleston Road and Church Road.The present Postmaster and his wife have been at the Post Office since 1960. There is a telephone outside and there is also one up Beacon Road.You can pay your bills and get pensions and family allowance from the Post Office.And there is a Bank called National Girobank.The Post Office provides a very important service in the village of Rolleston.
